page.title: 01Dunnerdale,Duddon & Between
page.content: Mostly hilly heathr-covered moorland it is comparatively remote and attracts few visitors. The main occupation is non-arable farming, hill sheep and cattle with a few small dairy herds. Forestry and quarrying provides some work for the inhabitants, whilst catering for holiday-makers provides a necessary second income for several farms. Holday and retirement homes indicate the diminution of the agricultural work force, and the area looks back on its past of slate quarrying, iron mining and oak coppiling than to the future. Animals,birds and plants aboud, notably red quirrel, badger, fox, three species of deer, owls, kestrels, peregrines, buzzards,ravens, and an occasional golden eagle. The farmland enclosed by dry stone
